paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The most strongly associated SNP in this 7q36.1 region is within KCNH2 and was associated with schizophrenia.
Significant association was observed for minor allele homozygotes at four of these SNPs.

functional_data.summary: KCNH2-3.1 shows altered deactivation kinetics affecting neuronal firing patterns.

variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence from multiple independent samples.
variants.additional_notes: KCNH2-3.1 is a novel isoform with unique properties.
key_quotes: KCNH2-3.1 mRNA expression was significantly increased within the HF of patients versus healthy control subjects.
The mechanism by which the associated SNPs contribute to risk for schizophrenia and related phenotypes involves the regulation of KCNH2-3.1 transcription.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of SNPs associated with schizophrenia in KCNH2

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
